title: 110_s3524
content: The Act is titled the "Homeland Security and Law Enforcement Improvements Act of 2008." It defines the Department of Homeland Security and the Secretary of Homeland Security. It establishes an Office for State and Local Law Enforcement. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to establish an Office for State and Local Law Enforcement, headed by an Assistant Secretary with relevant experience. The Secretary can assign staff from other Department components to support the office's responsibilities. The Assistant Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement leads coordination of Department-wide policies for State and local law enforcement in disaster response, serves as a liaison between agencies, and ensures intelligence sharing requirements are met. The Assistant Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement coordinates homeland security grants to focus on terrorism prevention activities and ensures information sharing and fusion center training are conducted in cooperation with relevant agencies. The Assistant Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement coordinates homeland security grants for terrorism prevention activities and ensures information sharing with law enforcement agencies and fusion centers. They also develop a Law Enforcement Information Sharing Resource Center, coordinate the National Law Enforcement Deployment Team Program, and collaborate with various entities to establish national standards for training and protective equipment. The Assistant Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement establishes a National Law Enforcement Deployment Team Program to create teams of law enforcement personnel for immediate response to natural or man-made incidents. The Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement consults with relevant stakeholders to develop and implement a model Law Enforcement Deployment Team, exercise and train the teams, and create model policies and procedures. The Homeland Security and Law Enforcement Improvements Act of 2008 requires the development of Law Enforcement Deployment Teams in each region of FEMA, along with an implementation strategy for a National Law Enforcement Deployment Team Program. The National Law Enforcement Deployment Team Program must submit a report to relevant committees before implementation in any region other than the selected one. Authorization of appropriations is also included. The Law Enforcement Information Sharing Resource Center is established within the Office for State and Local Law Enforcement to provide technical assistance on information sharing and intelligence among various law enforcement agencies. Authorization of appropriations includes $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009 and 2010, and necessary sums for fiscal years 2011 through 2015. The Law Enforcement Information Sharing Resource Center, under the Office for State and Local Law Enforcement, aims to develop a repository for guidance, templates, best practices, and data sets. It will consult with state and local law enforcement agencies and consolidate access to relevant resources. The Law Enforcement Information Sharing Resource Center aims to consolidate access to Department resources, provide technical assistance to law enforcement agencies, and coordinate intelligence-related training and services with FEMA and the Office of Intelligence and Analysis for State and local agencies. The Foreign Liaison Officers Against Terrorism Program is established within the Office of State and Local Law Enforcement, with authorized appropriations for fiscal years 2009-2015. The Assistant Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement is responsible for carrying out the program's duties. The Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement identifies foreign cities for law enforcement agencies to share information with, assigning them to agencies in the Foreign Liaison Officers Against Terrorism Program to obtain relevant information. The grant funds awarded under section 2003 can be used for participation in the Foreign Liaison Officers Against Terrorism Program, allowing for information sharing with other law enforcement agencies. SEC. 4. LAW ENFORCEMENT TERRORISM PREVENTION PROGRAM. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to allow the Assistant Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement to make grants for terrorism prevention activities. $500,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2009 through 2015 for this purpose. The Assistant Secretary for State and Local Law Enforcement may use up to 10 percent of funds for discretionary grants for national best practices and effective programs, including national projects, model program development, terrorism prevention guidelines, innovative projects, and program evaluations. The Assistant Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress on goals and recommendations for the nation's terrorism prevention strategy. SEC. 2041. COMMERCIAL EQUIPMENT DIRECT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM under Title XX of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 provides assistance for commercial equipment. The Commercial Equipment Direct Assistance Program is established within the Office of State and Local Law Enforcement to provide counterterrorism technology, equipment, and information to local law enforcement agencies. The program includes publishing a list of available resources, consulting with relevant entities, and accepting applications from agencies seeking to improve their capabilities. The Commercial Equipment Direct Assistance Program aims to enhance homeland security capabilities of local law enforcement agencies by providing approved technology, equipment, and training. Authorization of appropriations includes $75,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009 and 2010, and necessary sums for fiscal years 2011 through 2015.
